Selected Answer: D
Some tricks here
 - vbond default route nexthop .254 is not in 11.1.1.0/28, but all Controllers can reachable with connected switching.
 - hostname on vBond is incorrect but no impact
 - vBond 11.1.1.1 local ->> it will cause WAN Edge device could not found vBond, but for controllers, no need this commands to establish, (Designate the local vEdge router to be a vBond orchestrator in the vEdge overlay network domain.)
- Duplicate system-ip vSmart and vManage. -> it cause connections could not be establishedd

Selected Answer: D
system IP cannot be the same.
wrong: system IP = 10.11.11.1 on both vManage en vSmart ! So 11.1.1.x not a system IP.
Shouldn't it be 10.11.11.2 ? There is vM as 10.11.11.1, vB as 10.11.11.3
stoopid question - possable typo in answer d Reconfigure the system-ip parameter on vSmart to 11.1.1.2. should maybe be 10.11.11.2

Selected Answer: D
D is correct answer
Multiple mistakes in this one. vBond has interface IP 11.1.1.3/28 with a route configured pointing towards 11.1.1.254. That's not even in the 11.1.1.0/28 subnet...
This question is horribly written with no good answer whatsoever. None of the answers fix the obvious problem of vbond having the wrong IP in the 'vbond x.x.x.x local' statement.

vSmart IP is incorrect.
vBond ip 11.1.1.1 local should be vBond local

A correct

choices.B: Configure the (11.1.1.X/24) IP addresses on the eth0 interfaces on vManage and vSmart.
choices.A: Change the timezone on the vSmart to Europe/London.
choices.C: Configure the tunnel interface on all three controllers with a color of transport.
choices.D: Reconfigure the system-ip parameter on vSmart to 11.1.1.2.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. vManage and vSmart have an issue establishing a connection to vBond. Which configuration resolves the issue?

comments.content: Because traffic from 172.16.X.X should go to the DIA. If we don't specify the destination-ip, that will mean all traffic from 172.16.X.X will go through sequence 1 without a chance going to DIA. Unless we specify the destination-ip. If we specify it, every other traffic sourced from 172.16.X.X and not going to 172.16.X.X will go to NAT DIA.
why all the packets will match sequence 1? I think only match packets with origin 172.16.x.x. answer D is correct for me.

discussion.content: B is correct. Answer D is wrong because all the packets will match the sequence 1, so never a packet will check the sequence 2 to use NAT to the internet.

Selected Answer: D
there is no way B is correct. The destination match is wrong. I'll go with D

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

Selected Answer: B
Correct B
I think D is correct, matching the same source and destination seems wrong to me,

im going with B

C is correct. See link below: "We created a CENTRALIZED POLICY using the vManage GUI. In this policy, we have created another CONTROL POLICY that matches the hub TLOCs and accepts them, all other TLOCs are rejected by the default action at the end - Reject."

It is vAnalitics --> Cisco vAnalytics is a cloud-based analytics service for Cisco SD-WAN offering comprehensive insights into application and network performance. The analytics service is available with Cisco DNA Advantage and Cisco DNA Premier software subscriptions. cloud on ramp for colocation is used when you have a colocation datacenter and you want to
